PALL.description:
Blocks debugger read/write access to all CPU registers and memory mapped
        addresses.
Blocks NVMC ERASEALL and CTRLAP ERASEALL functionality. Using any value except Unprotected will lead to the protection being enabled.

APPCLEAR_0.description: Sets the corresponding bits in the CTIAPPSET to 0. There is one bit of the register for each channel.

APPCLEAR_1.description: Sets the corresponding bits in the CTIAPPSET to 0. There is one bit of the register for each channel.

APPCLEAR_2.description: Sets the corresponding bits in the CTIAPPSET to 0. There is one bit of the register for each channel.

APPCLEAR_3.description: Sets the corresponding bits in the CTIAPPSET to 0. There is one bit of the register for each channel.

APPULSE_0.description: Setting a bit HIGH generates a channel event pulse for the selected channel. There is one bit of the register for each channel.

APPULSE_1.description: Setting a bit HIGH generates a channel event pulse for the selected channel. There is one bit of the register for each channel.

APPULSE_2.description: Setting a bit HIGH generates a channel event pulse for the selected channel. There is one bit of the register for each channel.

APPULSE_3.description: Setting a bit HIGH generates a channel event pulse for the selected channel. There is one bit of the register for each channel.

TRIGINEN_0.description: Enables a cross trigger event to channel 0 when a ctitrigin input is activated.

TRIGINEN_1.description: Enables a cross trigger event to channel 1 when a ctitrigin input is activated.

TRIGINEN_2.description: Enables a cross trigger event to channel 2 when a ctitrigin input is activated.

TRIGINEN_3.description: Enables a cross trigger event to channel 3 when a ctitrigin input is activated.

TRIGOUTEN_0.description: Enables a cross trigger event to ctitrigout when channel 0 is activated.

TRIGOUTEN_1.description: Enables a cross trigger event to ctitrigout when channel 1 is activated.

TRIGOUTEN_2.description: Enables a cross trigger event to ctitrigout when channel 2 is activated.

TRIGOUTEN_3.description: Enables a cross trigger event to ctitrigout when channel 3 is activated.

CTICHINSTATUS_1.description: Shows the status of the ctitrigin 1 input.

CTICHINSTATUS_2.description: Shows the status of the ctitrigin 2 input.

CTICHINSTATUS_3.description: Shows the status of the ctitrigin 3 input.

EXTMUXNUM.description:
Indicates the number of multiplexers available on Trigger Inputs and Trigger Outputs that are using asicctl.
                    The default value of 0b00000 indicates that no multiplexing is present.

MAJOR.description:
Major classification of the type of the debug component as specified in the Arm Architecture Specification for this
                    debug and trace component.

SUB.description:
Sub-classification of the type of the debug component as specified in the Arm Architecture Specification within
                    the major classification as specified in the MAJOR field.

DES_2.description: Together, PIDR1.DES_0, PIDR2.DES_1, and PIDR4.DES_2 identify the designer of the component.

SIZE.description: Always 0b0000. Indicates that the device only occupies 4KB of memory.

PART_0.description: Bits[7:0] of the 12-bit part number of the component. The designer of the component assigns this part number.

PART_1.description: Bits[11:8] of the 12-bit part number of the component. The designer of the component assigns this part number.

DES_0.description: Together, PIDR1.DES_0, PIDR2.DES_1, and PIDR4.DES_2 identify the designer of the component.

DES_1.description: Together, PIDR1.DES_0, PIDR2.DES_1, and PIDR4.DES_2 identify the designer of the component.

JEDEC.description: Always 1. Indicates that the JEDEC-assigned designer ID is used.

CMOD.description:
Customer Modified. Indicates whether the customer has modified the behavior of the component. In most cases,
                    this field is 0b0000. Customers change this value when they make authorized modifications to this component.

REVAND.description:
Indicates minor errata fixes specific to the revision of the component being used, for example metal fixes after
                    implementation. In most cases, this field is 0b0000. Arm recommends that the component designers ensure that a
                    metal fix can change this field if required, for example, by driving it from registers that reset to 0b0000.

PRMBL_0.description: Preamble[0]. Contains bits[7:0] of the component identification code.

PRMBL_1.description: Preamble[1]. Contains bits[11:8] of the component identification code.

CLASS.description:
Class of the component, for example, whether the component is a ROM table or a generic CoreSight component.
                    Contains bits[15:12] of the component identification code

PRMBL_2.description: Preamble[2]. Contains bits[23:16] of the component identification code.

PRMBL_3.description: Preamble[3]. Contains bits[31:24] of the component identification code.

TXDATA.description: Data sent from the CPU to the debugger.

LOCK.description: This register locks the APPROTECT.DISABLE register from being written to until next reset.

DISABLE.description: This register disables the APPROTECT register and enables debug access to non-secure mode.

RXSTATUS.description: Status of data in register RXDATA

TXSTATUS.description: Status of data in register TXDATA

LOCK.description: Lock the APPROTECT.DISABLE register from being written to until next reset

KEY.description:
If the value of the KEY field is non-zero, and the KEY fields match on both the
        CPU and debugger sides, disable APPROTECT and enable debug access to non-secure mode until
        the next pin reset, brown-out reset, power-on reset, or watchog timer reset. After reset the debugger side register has a fixed KEY value. To enable debug access, both CTRL-AP and UICR.APPROTECT protection needs to be disabled.

NUMBEROF8US.description: Length of the AoA/AoD procedure in number of 8 us units

TSWITCHSPACING.description: Interval between every time the antenna is changed in the SWITCHING state

AGCBACKOFFGAIN.description: Gain will be lowered by the specified number of gain steps at the start of CTE

TSWITCHOFFSET.description: Signed value offset after the end of the CRC before starting switching in number of 16 MHz clock cycles

TSAMPLEOFFSET.description: Signed value offset in number of 16 MHz clock cycles for fine tuning of the sampling instant for all IQ samples. With TSAMPLEOFFSET=0 the first sample is taken immediately at the start of the reference period

RXDELAY.description: Sample delay for input serial data on MISO. The value specifies the number of 64 MHz clock cycles (15.625 ns) delay from the the sampling edge of SCK (leading edge for CONFIG.CPHA = 0, trailing edge for CONFIG.CPHA = 1) until the input serial data is sampled. As en example, if RXDELAY = 0 and CONFIG.CPHA = 0, the input serial data is sampled on the rising edge of SCK.

CSNDUR.description: Minimum duration between edge of CSN and edge of SCK and minimum duration CSN must stay high between transactions. The value is specified in number of 64 MHz clock cycles (15.625 ns).

DCXCNT.description: This register specifies the number of command bytes preceding the data bytes. The PSEL.DCX line will be low during transmission of command bytes and high during transmission of data bytes. Value 0xF indicates that all bytes are command bytes.

ORC.description: Byte transmitted after TXD.MAXCNT bytes have been transmitted in the case when RXD.MAXCNT is greater than TXD.MAXCNT.

TASKS_STOP.description: Stop TWI transaction. Must be issued while the TWI master is not suspended.

EVENTS_SUSPENDED.description: SUSPEND task has been issued, TWI traffic is now suspended.

EVENTS_LASTRX.description: Byte boundary, starting to receive the last byte

EVENTS_LASTTX.description: Byte boundary, starting to transmit the last byte

SHORTS.description: Shortcuts between local events and tasks

ADDR.description: Description cluster: Start address of region to protect. The start address must be word-aligned.

SIZE.description: Description cluster: Size of region to protect counting from address ACL[n].ADDR. Writing a '0' has no effect.

PERM.description: Description cluster: Access permissions for region n as defined by start address ACL[n].ADDR and size ACL[n].SIZE

ADDR.description: Start address of flash region n. The start address must point to a flash page boundary.

SIZE.description: Size of flash region n in bytes. Must be a multiple of the flash page size.

WRITE.description: Configure write and erase permissions for region n. Writing a '0' has no effect.

READ.description: Configure read permissions for region n. Writing a '0' has no effect.

ERASEALL.description: Register for erasing all non-volatile user memory

READYNEXT.description: NVMC can accept a new write operation

WEN.description: Program memory access mode. It is strongly recommended to only activate erase and write modes when they are actively used. Enabling write or erase will invalidate the cache and keep it invalidated.

ERASEALL.description: Erase all non-volatile memory including UICR registers. Before the non-volatile memory can be erased, erasing must be enabled by setting CONFIG.WEN=Een.

DURATION.description: Duration of the partial erase in milliseconds

HITS.description: Number of cache hits Write zero to clear

MISSES.description: Number of cache misses Write zero to clear
